item.title: Epic Games Releases Unreal Engine 5.4
item.description:
Highlights

  • Unreal Engine 5.4 is out, aiming to streamline 3D animation and allow complex geometry work.
  • Epic Games used Unreal Engine 5.4 for Fortnite development, highlighting animation upgrades and machine learning capabilities.
  • Exciting upcoming releases like Marvel 1943 and Black Myth: Wukong showcase Unreal Engine 5's potential.

Epic Games has released Unreal Engine 5.4 along with a video highlighting its improvements. Epic has been working on the Unreal Engine for a long time and as the developer has grown, so has the ambition of its engine. Unreal Engine 5 was released in 2022, and this iteration of the engine focuses on streamlining real-time 3D animation even further and allowing more complex work on geometry to be done.

Many are excited about the ability the engine has to make new titles look as stunning as possible. Recently, Unreal Engine 5.4 graphics were shown off in the trailer for Marvel 1943: Rise of Hydra , and although there is little known about the overall game, plenty of gamers are looking forward to seeing more of it.

Related
Dune: Awakening Reveals How It Is Using Unreal Engine 5
Developers for the upcoming survival MMO, Dune: Awakening, elaborate on their decision to use Unreal Engine 5 to bring the world of Arrakis to life.

Unreal Engine 5.4, which Epic Games has been using internally for development on Fortnite and its additional game modes, is now available to the public. Highlighted improvements to the engine include upgrades to the engine's animation toolset, which allows animators to rig characters more easily and author animation in-engine. Additionally, a Modular Control rig that builds rigs from modular parts instead of graphs has been included as an experimental feature.

Unreal Engine 5's virtualized micropolygon geometry system named Nanite has been upgraded with an experimental Tessellation feature, as well as Variable Rate Shading for performance, and added support for spline mesh workflows. Rendering features such as Temporal Super Resolution have been updated for stability and performance, and machine learning capabilities progress as Unreal Engine 5.4 shifts its Neural Network Engine from experimental to Beta. There is a long list of games using Unreal Engine 5 , and they may be able to benefit from the way the engine can simplify development.

The Potential of Unreal Engine 5

There are plenty of upcoming game releases to look forward to that Unreal Engine 5 is being used for. Aside from Marvel 1943 , one of the most visually impressive games set for a 2024 release is Black Myth: Wukong , a Chinese-mythology-inspired game using gameplay similar to popular action RPGs like Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice and the Nioh series. With combat as fast-paced and visuals as dense as previews show, many are hopeful that the final product is reflective of everything they have seen so far.

There are plenty of gamers excited to see the new things made possible by Unreal Engine 5. The engine is recognized by plenty of gamers as one of the best video game engines on the market, and with consistent evolution, the reputation it has for producing some of the most stunning graphics will likely improve. This includes upcoming releases such as the sequel to Cyberpunk 2077 . CD Projekt Red's move to Unreal was confusing to some because the team already had an in-house engine, but other Cyberpunk 2077 fans are looking forward to the potential that the release has. With constantly updating games like Fortnite and upcoming releases like Black Myth Wukong , gamers and developers alike may be able to see more of what Unreal Engine 5 can offer.

item.title: Some MultiVersus Fans Think Barbie is Coming to the Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • MultiVersus teases possible Barbie appearance with cryptic tweet, sparking player speculation for upcoming content.
  • Fans eagerly anticipate MultiVersus return on May 28 with new characters, stages, and parry mechanics promised.
  • Potential inclusion of Barbie in MultiVersus could capitalize on film success and boost game popularity.

MultiVersus has published a new tweet, and some players are now thinking about Barbie's possible appearance in the game. After a long wait, MultiVersus is finally coming back on May 28. Players are looking forward to what Warner Bros. Interactive's fighting game has in store after enjoying a good reception during the beta.

Joining the list of Super Smash Bros. clones, MultiVersus offers its twist by pitting characters from different Warner properties in battle, such as Bugs Bunny and Taz from Looney Tunes , Game of Thrones 's Arya Stark, and even the lovable Iron Giant. But with the end of the beta came the surprise that MultiVersus would go offline to return at a later date. This year, MultiVersus confirmed new features that players will find in the brawler and revealed significant changes, such as the inclusion of parry mechanics. MultiVersus has now released another promotional image, and players suspect it may indicate good news.

Related
When MultiVersus Returns, It Needs to Make a Statement
MultiVersus needs to make a statement with new characters, stages and modes if it hopes to have a resurgence when it returns in 2024.

MultiVersus has published a new tweet that is making some players believe that Barbie may be joining the game's roster. With the caption "What happened in the off-season?," recalling MultiVersus ' unexpected hiatus , the tweet shows the answer "saw the hit movie of the summer" written in Barbie's official font. The image has Harley Quinn, Superman, Shaggy, and Velma wearing pink clothes, with a pink house in the background, referencing the movie directed by Greta Gerwig.

MultiVersus Continues Sequence of Cryptic Tweets

MultiVersus ' "Barbie tweet" isn't the first tease made recently about future content players might see in Warner Bros. Interactive's fighting game. Previously, MultiVersus released a teaser showing cel-shaded skins for Superman, LeBron James, Velma, Taz, and Jake from Adventure Time . In a second tweet, a fan found evidence that a highly requested MultiVersus skin may be coming , giving Finn the Human his iconic robotic arm and the Night Sword. In another post, the official MultiVersus Twitter suggested that Powerpuff Girls may also be on their way.

There's no official word on Barbie's debut in MultiVersus , but it wouldn't be a surprise to see the character added to the game at some point. The flick starring Margot Robbie and Ryan Gosling became the highest global debut for a Warner Bros. film, while at the domestic box office, it surpassed the fan-favorite The Dark Knight . As a result, Barbie's debut would surely help attract players' attention, potentially boosting the game's popularity on its return by riding the wave established by the 2023 film, also making players curious about which characters MultiVersus might add in the future .

item.title: Metaphor: ReFantazio is Missing a Popular Persona Game Mechanic
item.description:
Highlights

  • Metaphor: ReFantazio will be missing the romantic relationship options found in Persona games, but features its own social bond-building system.
  • Players can deepen relationships with allies to unlock new Archetypes in Metaphor: ReFantazio.
  • Despite some differences, Metaphor: ReFantazio shares similarities with Persona and Shin Megami Tensei series.

Atlus game fans are looking forward to Metaphor: ReFantazio , but the game is going to be missing a common mechanic of Persona games that players enjoy: building romances with NPCs. While the mechanic may be missed, it's another indication that Metaphor: ReFantazio and its Shin Megami Tensei and Persona predecessors do differ, despite their similarities.

Metaphor: ReFantazio is heading towards a release later this year, and is set to bring fans of RPGs to a mythical and magical medieval world instead of the usual real-life exploration of Japan and its shadowy hidden side. Metaphor: ReFantazio will differ from Persona games in various ways, including the playable protagonist being having a voice and dialogue.

Related
Metaphor: ReFantazio Reveals Release Date and New Gameplay Details
After a new broadcast from the developers, Metaphor: ReFantazio finally reveals to players the release date and other exciting details.

According to Atlus during the game's recent livestream , as translated by Siliconera , Metaphor: ReFantazio is known to be bringing in a social bond-building system, but it's going to lack romantic relationship options. In Persona games, some characters can build a bond with the playable protagonist, and a possibility for romance eventually opens up. While some of Persona 's romantic partners are questionable, it's nonetheless a popular mechanic that players have come to enjoy. Metaphor: ReFantazio may be lacking this due to the type of bonding system the game has.

In Metaphor: ReFantazio , players can deepen their relationships with followers, learning more about them and eventually allowing the player to unlock new Archetypes. In contrast in Persona 5 , reaching a certain point in a character's side quests or going through the story with them would improve Joker's abilities and Personas , but also opened the door to romance with some allies and confidants. While the possibility of wooing multiple characters is off the table, it remains to be seen if the game will feature a story-based romance or not.

What Mechanics are Returning from the Persona and Shin Megami Tensei series?

While there seem to be some considerable differences between Metaphor: ReFantazio and the Persona or Shin Megami Tensei series, there are still some mechanics that are making a comeback.

Metaphor: ReFantazio will feature a calendar system similar to that of Persona , which is used to measure the passage of time and allow certain events to be time-locked in the Persona series. The game will also feature Shin Megami Tensei 's Press Turn Battle system . Some skills will also be returning from the mainline Shin Megami Tensei series. With Metaphor: ReFantazio 's director, artist, and musical composer all having previously worked on Shin Megami Tensei entries, there's bound to be other similarities as well in the game's theme and general aesthetics.

item.title: Gigabyte Reveals New Mini PCs
item.description:
Highlights

  • Gigabyte debuts Metal Gear Plus ITX mini PCs with powerful Hawk Point processors for customizable builds in China.
  • AMD Ryzen 8000G APUs power the mini PCs with AORUS B560I ITX motherboards, DDR5 memory, and NVMe storage options.
  • Pricing for Gigabyte's new mini PCs in China ranges from 3999 to 5899 RMB, but details for international release are pending.

Gigabyte has unveiled new "Metal Gear Plus ITX" mini PCs, which feature AMD's "Hawk Point" processors. The new mini PCs from Gigabyte will be available in three different configurations, and seasoned PC builders will be able to customize their chosen variant.

Gigabyte is a major computer hardware manufacturer and a board partner for both Nvidia and AMD. Gigabyte's products range from value-oriented offerings for new PC builders to high-end motherboards and GPUs from Gigabyte's AORUS brand. The company continues to compete with other Taiwan-based manufacturers, thanks to a wide range of powerful PC components with aesthetically pleasing designs.

Related
Best CPUs to Play Horizon Forbidden West PC in 2024
If you want to enjoy Horizon Forbidden West on PC, heres a list of CPUs that will allow you to do just that.

As reported by Videocardz.com , Gigabyte unveiled its new Metal Gear Plus ITX mini PCs in China, which do not have an affiliation with Konami's Metal Gear franchise. Enclosed in a CNC aluminum chassis, each mini PC is powered by an AMD Ryzen 8000G Hawk Point processor and an AORUS B560I ITX motherboard, which comes with 16 GB of XPG D300 DDR5 memory and 512 GB to 1 TB of NVMe M.2 storage. The Ryzen APU is cooled by a low-profile CPU cooler inside the 3-liter PC chassis. Users are able to unscrew panels on the chassis to open the PC and replace the motherboard, APU, CPU cooler, memory, and storage if desired. Unlike other mini PCs, Gigabyte's Metal Gear Plus ITX appears to cater to PC builders, and users will be able to purchase one of Gigabyte's new mini PCs with either a Ryzen 5 8500G, Ryzen 5 8600G, or Ryzen 7 8700G APU installed.

Gigabyte Unveils Metal Gear Plus ITX Mini PCs

  • Launching in China with three configurations:
    • Ryzen 5 8500G: 3999 to 4499 Chinese RMB ($611 to $693)
    • Ryzen 5 8600G: 4269 to 4799 RMB ($660 to $740)
    • Ryzen 7 8700G: 5259 to 5899 RMB ($811 to $909)

  • Comes with 16 GB of DDR5 and up to 1 TB of NVMe M.2 storage

Thanks to the Hawk Point processors, users wanting to play the latest PC games can leverage the power of Radeon 700M integrated GPUs, which are based on the RDNA3 architecture used in Radeon RX 7000 series GPUs . The power supply for Metal Gear Plus ITX mini PCs is external, with Gigabyte opting for the use of AC to DC connectors for a DC-ATX 180W power supply. This may be a drawback for some users, since the connectors can't be used with standard power supplies typically used in gaming PCs.

In China, those wanting a new Gigabyte mini PC can expect to purchase one starting at around 3999 to 4499 Chinese RMB ($611 to $693) for the Ryzen 5 8500G variant. The Ryzen 5 8600G Metal Gear Plus ITX PC will cost 4269 to 4799 RMB ($660 to $740), and the Ryzen 7 8700G variant will be the most expensive one, at around 5259 to 5899 RMB ($811 to $909). It's worth noting that pricing has not been finalized for regions outside of China, and a release date has not been announced.

item.title: Pokemon Sleep Themed Hotel Room Opens in Famous Hotel Chain
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon Sleep and Hyatt Hotel partner to create a Pokemon Sleep-themed room for fans to enjoy.
  • Pokemon Sleep app tracks and improves sleep patterns, allowing players to recruit Pokemon to their team.
  • Fans staying in the room can take home Pokemon plush toys and enjoy themed menu items at the hotel's restaurant.

Pokemon Sleep and the Hyatt Hotel Corporation have partnered to create a Pokemon Sleep -themed room for fans to stay in. The entire room, in addition to the hotel's menu, have been customized as a way of celebrating the first anniversary of the Pokemon Sleep app.

Pokemon Sleep is a bit unusual in the realm of Pokemon games and apps. While most Pokemon titles are games first and foremost, Pokemon Sleep is designed to be a way of tracking and improving one's sleep patterns. By recording the player's sleep, Pokemon in the game flock to a snoozing island Snorlax to take a nap. After the recording is complete, the player can recruit the Pokemon to their team, who can then find ingredients for creating meals for Snorlax, as well as providing additional bonuses in the game.

Related
Pokemon GO Updates Biomes, Launches Rediscover Kanto Event
The latest Pokemon GO update brings a variety of quality-of-life improvements and introduces a new event for players to rediscover Kanto.

Pokemon Sleep' s emphasis on sleeping and eating have been highlighted at the Grand Hyatt Hotel in Tokyo, Japan. From July 1 through September 1, the hotel is offering a Pokemon Sleep -themed room. The room is decked out with Pokemon plush toys and a mini campsite emulating the ones found in the app. Pokemon fans who stay in the room will be able to take home some of the fun with them, as well. Four normal-sized Pokemon plushies are added to every room, which fans can take home at the end of their stay.

In addition, a giveaway bag will be given to guests that contains a Pokemon- themed t-shirt, reusable mini drink bottle, herbal tea, and bath salts to unwind with. For big fans of Pokemon and Snorlax in particular, staying in the room should be quite a treat, but being able to take home a piece of the experience should also appeal to fans.

While the room and take-home bonuses are likely to please, the hotel is also offering a themed menu in its restaurant. The menu includes decorated Pokemon cookies, themed beverages, desserts, and burgers, with one featuring a Pikachu design and another featuring Snorlax. The designs appear to be partially based off the food recipes in Pokemon Sleep , so fans can try out some of their favorites in real life.

What's New in Pokemon Sleep

Pokemon Sleep regularly receives updates that add new events and bonuses to the game. New islands are also added on occasion, which bring new Pokemon encounters and rewards for players to earn. At the time of writing, Pokemon Sleep is hosting its latest Good Sleep Day event , which is held during every full moon for three nights. Players can earn extra EXP, Drowsy Power, and sleep points for logging their sleep time during this period.
